sentence.text: This is the first study to investigate the effect of vitamin D receptor ( negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II) gene single-nucleotide polymorphisms on the clinicopathologic features of papillary thyroid cancer in Turkey.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II gene polymorphisms BsmI, ApaI, and TaqI did not differ between the papillary thyroid cancer group and control group (p AAAA 0.05, each).

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: The negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II gene FokI CT/TT genotype was associated with an increased papillary thyroid cancer risk (CT vs CC: odds ratio = 1.71, 95% confidence interval = 1.15-2.76, p = 0.028; TT vs CC: odds ratio = 2.44, 95% confidence interval = 1.29-4.62, p = 0.005; CT/TT vs CC: odds ratio = 1.88, 95% confidence interval = 1.20-2.96, p = 0.006; CT/CC vs TT: odds ratio = 1.80, 95% confidence interval = 1.05-3.20, p = 0.041).

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II gene FokI T allele and TT genotype correlated with aggressiveness of papillary thyroid cancer; thus, FokI could be useful as a poor prognostic factor to assess the high risk of papillary thyroid cancer

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
